intro: Tambourissa moeheliensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a rare and striking orchid native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in the humid and warm climate of its native habitat. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tambourissa moeheliensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
